api_token.description: The API token for the Proxmox VE API.

auth_ticket.description: The pre-authenticated Ticket for the Proxmox VE API.

csrf_prevention_token.description: The pre-authenticated CSRF Prevention Token for the Proxmox VE API.

endpoint.description: The endpoint for the Proxmox VE API.

insecure.description: Whether to skip the TLS verification step.

min_tls.description: The minimum required TLS version for API calls.Supported values: `1.0|1.1|1.2|1.3`. Defaults to `1.3`.

otp.description: The one-time password for the Proxmox VE API.

password.description: The password for the Proxmox VE API.

random_vm_id_end.description: The ending number for random VM / Container IDs.

random_vm_id_start.description: The starting number for random VM / Container IDs.

random_vm_ids.description: Whether to generate random VM / Container IDs.

username.description: The username for the Proxmox VE API.

agent.description: Whether to use the SSH agent for authentication. Takes precedence over the `private_key` and `password` fields. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_AGENT` environment variable, or `false` if not set.

agent_forwarding.description: Whether to enable SSH agent forwarding. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_AGENT_FORWARDING` environment variable, or `false` if not set.

agent_socket.description: The path to the SSH agent socket. Defaults to the value of the `SSH_AUTH_SOCK` environment variable.

password.description: The password used for the SSH connection. Defaults to the value of the `password` field of the `provider` block.

private_key.description: The unencrypted private key (in PEM format) used for the SSH connection. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_PRIVATE_KEY` environment variable.

socks5_password.description: The password for the SOCKS5 proxy server. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_SOCKS5_PASSWORD` environment variable.

socks5_server.description: The address:port of the SOCKS5 proxy server. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_SOCKS5_SERVER` environment variable.

socks5_username.description: The username for the SOCKS5 proxy server. Defaults to the value of the `PROXMOX_VE_SSH_SOCKS5_USERNAME` environment variable.

username.description: The username used for the SSH connection. Defaults to the value of the `username` field of the `provider` block.

address.description: The address of the Proxmox VE node.

name.description: The name of the Proxmox VE node.

port.description: The port of the Proxmox VE node.

block.description: Overrides for SSH connection configuration for a Proxmox VE node.
The SSH configuration for the Proxmox nodes.

group_id.description: The group the ACL should apply to (mutually exclusive with `token_id` and `user_id`)

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

token_id.description: The token the ACL should apply to (mutually exclusive with `group_id` and `user_id`)

user_id.description: The user the ACL should apply to (mutually exclusive with `group_id` and `token_id`)

block.description:
Manages ACLs on the Proxmox cluster.

ACLs are used to control access to resources in the Proxmox cluster.
Each ACL consists of a path, a user, group or token, a role, and a flag to allow propagation of permissions.

created_at.description: The timestamp of the ACME account creation.

directory.description: The URL of the ACME CA directory endpoint.

eab_hmac_key.description: The HMAC key for External Account Binding.

eab_kid.description: The Key Identifier for External Account Binding.

location.description: The location of the ACME account.

name.description: The ACME account config file name.

tos.description: The URL of CA TermsOfService - setting this indicates agreement.

block.description:
Manages an ACME account in a Proxmox VE cluster.

~> This resource requires `root@pam` authentication.

digest.description: SHA1 digest of the current configuration. Prevent changes if current configuration file has a different digest. This can be used to prevent concurrent modifications.

validation_delay.description: Extra delay in seconds to wait before requesting validation. Allows to cope with a long TTL of DNS records (0 - 172800).

block.description: Manages an ACME plugin in a Proxmox VE cluster.

file_path.description: The absolute path of the source list file that contains this repository.

file_type.description: The format of the defining source list file.

id.description: The unique identifier of this APT repository resource.

index.description: The index within the defining source list file.

node.description: The name of the target Proxmox VE node.

block.description: Manages an APT repository of a Proxmox VE node.

description.description: The description of the APT standard repository.

file_path.description: The absolute path of the source list file that contains this standard repository.

handle.description: The handle of the APT standard repository. Must be `ceph-quincy-enterprise` | `ceph-quincy-no-subscription` | `ceph-quincy-test` | `ceph-reef-enterprise` | `ceph-reef-no-subscription` | `ceph-reef-test` | `ceph-squid-enterprise` | `ceph-squid-no-subscription` | `ceph-squid-test` | `enterprise` | `no-subscription` | `test`.

id.description: The unique identifier of this APT standard repository resource.

index.description: The index within the defining source list file.

name.description: The name of the APT standard repository.

node.description: The name of the target Proxmox VE node.

block.description: Manages an APT standard repository of a Proxmox VE node.

overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite an existing certificate

enabled.description: Enable or disable the firewall cluster-wide

burst.description: Initial burst of packages which will always get logged before the rate is applied

rate.description: Frequency with which the burst bucket gets refilled

container_id.description: The ID of the container to manage the firewall for.

name.description: Security group name

vm_id.description: The ID of the VM to manage the firewall for.

dest.description: Restrict packet destination address. This can refer to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP alias definition. You can also specify an address range like '20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99', or a list of IP addresses and networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4 and IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

dport.description: Restrict TCP/UDP destination port. You can use service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined in '/etc/services'. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for example '80:85', and you can use comma separated list to match several ports or ranges.

iface.description: Network interface name. You have to use network configuration key names for VMs and containers ('net\d+'). Host related rules can use arbitrary strings.

proto.description: Restrict packet protocol. You can use protocol names or simple numbers (0-255), as defined in '/etc/protocols'.

source.description: Restrict packet source address. This can refer to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP alias definition. You can also specify an address range like '20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99', or a list of IP addresses and networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4 and IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

sport.description: Restrict TCP/UDP source port. You can use service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined in '/etc/services'. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for example '80:85', and you can use comma separated list to match several ports or ranges.

bandwidth_limit_clone.description: Clone I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

bandwidth_limit_default.description: Default I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

bandwidth_limit_migration.description: Migration I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

bandwidth_limit_move.description: Move I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

bandwidth_limit_restore.description: Restore I/O bandwidth limit in KiB/s.

console.description: Select the default Console viewer. Must be `applet` | `vv`| `html5` | `xtermjs`. You can either use the builtin java applet (VNC; deprecated and maps to html5), an external virt-viewer compatible application (SPICE), an HTML5 based vnc viewer (noVNC), or an HTML5 based console client (xtermjs). If the selected viewer is not available (e.g. SPICE not activated for the VM), the fallback is noVNC.

crs_ha.description: Cluster resource scheduling setting for HA. Must be `static` | `basic` (default is `basic`).

crs_ha_rebalance_on_start.description: Cluster resource scheduling setting for HA rebalance on start.

description.description: Datacenter description. Shown in the web-interface datacenter notes panel. This is saved as comment inside the configuration file.

email_from.description: email address to send notification from (default is root@$hostname).

ha_shutdown_policy.description: Cluster wide HA shutdown policy (). Must be `freeze` | `failover` | `migrate` | `conditional` (default is `conditional`).

http_proxy.description: Specify external http proxy which is used for downloads (example: `http://username:password@host:port/`).

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

keyboard.description: Default keyboard layout for vnc server. Must be `de` | `de-ch` | `da` | `en-gb` | `en-us` | `es` | `fi` | `fr` | `fr-be` | `fr-ca` | `fr-ch` | `hu` | `is` | `it` | `ja` | `lt` | `mk` | `nl` | `no` | `pl` | `pt` | `pt-br` | `sv` | `sl` | `tr`.

max_workers.description: Defines how many workers (per node) are maximal started on actions like 'stopall VMs' or task from the ha-manager.

migration_type.description: Cluster wide migration type. Must be `secure` | `insecure` (default is `secure`).

lower.description: The minimum number for the next free VM ID. Must be higher or equal to 100

upper.description: The maximum number for the next free VM ID. Must be less or equal to 999999999

next_id.description: The ranges for the next free VM ID auto-selection pool.

ha_fencing_mode.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the HA fencing mode. Must be `always` | `never`.

ha_fencing_target.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the HA fencing target.

package_updates.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for package updates. Must be `auto` | `always` | `never`.

package_updates_target.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the package updates target.

replication.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for replication. Must be `always` | `never`.

replication_target.description: Cluster-wide notification settings for the replication target.

block.description: Manages Proxmox VE Cluster Datacenter options.

ipv4.description: The container's IPv4 addresses per network device

ipv6.description: The container's IPv6 addresses per network device

pool_id.description: The ID of the pool to assign the container to

protection.description: Whether to set the protection flag of the container. This will prevent the container itself and its disk for remove/update operations.

start_on_boot.description: Automatically start container when the host system boots.

tags.description: Tags of the container. This is only meta information.

unprivileged.description: Whether the container runs as unprivileged on the host

datastore_id.description: The ID of the target datastore

node_name.description: The name of the source node

vm_id.description: The ID of the source container

enabled.description: Whether to enable the console device

deny_write.description: Deny the container to write to the device

gid.description: Group ID to be assigned to the device node

mode.description: Access mode to be set on the device node (e.g. 0666)

path.description: Device to pass through to the container

block.description: Device to pass through to the container

fuse.description: Whether the container supports FUSE mounts

keyctl.description: Whether the container supports `keyctl()` system call

nesting.description: Whether the container runs as nested

acl.description: Explicitly enable or disable ACL support

backup.description: Whether to include the mount point in backups (only used for volume mount points)

path.description: Path to the mount point as seen from inside the container

quota.description: Enable user quotas inside the container (not supported with volume mounts)

replicate.description: Will include this volume to a storage replica job

shared.description: Mark this non-volume mount point as available on all nodes

size.description: Volume size (only used for volume mount points)

volume.description: Volume, device or directory to mount into the container

enabled.description: Whether to enable the network device

firewall.description: Whether this interface's firewall rules should be used.

name.description: The network interface name

rate_limit.description: The rate limit in megabytes per second

template_file_id.description: The ID of an OS template file

down_delay.description: A non-negative number defining the delay in seconds before the next container is shut down

order.description: A non-negative number defining the general startup order

up_delay.description: A non-negative number defining the delay in seconds before the next container is started

block.description: Defines startup and shutdown behavior of the container

checksum.description: The expected checksum of the file.

checksum_algorithm.description: The algorithm to calculate the checksum of the file. Must be `md5` | `sha1` | `sha224` | `sha256` | `sha384` | `sha512`.

content_type.description: The file content type. Must be `iso` or `import` for VM images or `vztmpl` for LXC images.

datastore_id.description: The identifier for the target datastore.

decompression_algorithm.description: Decompress the downloaded file using the specified compression algorithm. Must be one of `gz` | `lzo` | `zst` | `bz2`.

file_name.description: The file name. If not provided, it is calculated using `url`. PVE will raise 'wrong file extension' error for some popular extensions file `.raw` or `.qcow2` on PVE versions prior to 8.4. Workaround is to use e.g. `.img` instead.

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

overwrite.description: By default `true`. If `true` and file size has changed in the datastore, it will be replaced. If `false`, there will be no check.

overwrite_unmanaged.description: If `true` and a file with the same name already exists in the datastore, it will be deleted and the new file will be downloaded. If `false` and the file already exists, an error will be returned.

upload_timeout.description: The file download timeout seconds. Default is 600 (10min).

url.description: The URL to download the file from. Must match regex: `https?://.*`.

verify.description: By default `true`. If `false`, no SSL/TLS certificates will be verified.

block.description: Manages files upload using PVE download-url API. It can be fully compatible and faster replacement for image files created using `proxmox_virtual_environment_file`. Supports images for VMs (ISO and disk images) and LXC (CT Templates).

file_mode.description: The file mode in octal format, e.g. "0700" or "600".Note that the prefixes "0o" and "0x" are not supported!Setting this attribute is also only allowed for "root@pam" authenticated user.

overwrite.description: Whether to overwrite the file if it already exists

timeout_upload.description: Timeout for uploading ISO/VSTMPL files in seconds

changed.description: Whether the source file has changed since the last run

checksum.description: The SHA256 checksum of the source file

file_name.description: The file name to use instead of the source file name

insecure.description: Whether to skip the TLS verification step for HTTPS sources

min_tls.description: The minimum required TLS version for HTTPS sources.Supported values: `1.0|1.1|1.2|1.3`. Defaults to `1.3`.

path.description: A path to a local file or a URL

resize.description: The number of bytes to resize the file to

container_id.description: The ID of the container to manage the firewall for.

name.description: Alias name

vm_id.description: The ID of the VM to manage the firewall for.

container_id.description: The ID of the container to manage the firewall for.

name.description: IPSet name

vm_id.description: The ID of the VM to manage the firewall for.

name.description: Network/IP specification in CIDR format

container_id.description: The ID of the container to manage the firewall for.

ipfilter.description: Enable default IP filters. This is equivalent to adding an empty ipfilter-net<id> ipset for every interface. Such ipsets implicitly contain sane default restrictions such as restricting IPv6 link local addresses to the one derived from the interface's MAC address. For containers the configured IP addresses will be implicitly added.

vm_id.description: The ID of the VM to manage the firewall for.

container_id.description: The ID of the container to manage the firewall for.

vm_id.description: The ID of the VM to manage the firewall for.

dest.description: Restrict packet destination address. This can refer to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP alias definition. You can also specify an address range like '20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99', or a list of IP addresses and networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4 and IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

dport.description: Restrict TCP/UDP destination port. You can use service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined in '/etc/services'. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for example '80:85', and you can use comma separated list to match several ports or ranges.

iface.description: Network interface name. You have to use network configuration key names for VMs and containers ('net\d+'). Host related rules can use arbitrary strings.

proto.description: Restrict packet protocol. You can use protocol names or simple numbers (0-255), as defined in '/etc/protocols'.

source.description: Restrict packet source address. This can refer to a single IP address, an IP set ('+ipsetname') or an IP alias definition. You can also specify an address range like '20.34.101.207-201.3.9.99', or a list of IP addresses and networks (entries are separated by comma). Please do not mix IPv4 and IPv6 addresses inside such lists.

sport.description: Restrict TCP/UDP source port. You can use service names or simple numbers (0-65535), as defined in '/etc/services'. Port ranges can be specified with '\d+:\d+', for example '80:85', and you can use comma separated list to match several ports or ranges.

propagate.description: Whether to propagate to child paths

comment.description: The comment associated with this group

group.description: The identifier of the High Availability group to manage.

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

no_failback.description: A flag that indicates that failing back to a higher priority node is disabled for this HA group. Defaults to `false`.

nodes.description: The member nodes for this group. They are provided as a map, where the keys are the node names and the values represent their priority: integers for known priorities or `null` for unset priorities.

restricted.description: A flag that indicates that other nodes may not be used to run resources associated to this HA group. Defaults to `false`.

block.description: Manages a High Availability group in a Proxmox VE cluster.

comment.description: The comment of this directory mapping.

id.description: The unique identifier of this directory mapping resource.

node.description: The node this mapping applies to.

path.description: The path of the map. For directory mappings the path is required and refers to the POSIX path of the directory as visible from the node.

map.description: The actual map of devices for the hardware mapping.

name.description: The name of this directory mapping.

block.description: Manages a directory mapping in a Proxmox VE cluster.

comment.description: The comment of this PCI hardware mapping.

id.description: The unique identifier of this PCI hardware mapping resource.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped PCI device.

id.description: The ID of the map.

iommu_group.description: The IOMMU group of the map. Not mandatory for the Proxmox VE API call, but causes a PCI hardware mapping to be incomplete when not set

node.description: The node name of the map.

subsystem_id.description: The subsystem ID group of the map. Not mandatory for the Proxmox VE API call, but causes a PCI hardware mapping to be incomplete when not set

map.description: The actual map of devices for the PCI hardware mapping.

mediated_devices.description: Indicates whether to enable mediated devices.

name.description: The name of this PCI hardware mapping.

block.description: Manages a PCI hardware mapping in a Proxmox VE cluster.

comment.description: The comment of this USB hardware mapping.

id.description: The unique identifier of this USB hardware mapping resource.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped USB device.

id.description: The ID of the map.

node.description: The node name of the map.

path.description: The path of the map. For hardware mappings of type USB the path is optional and indicates that the device is mapped through the device ID instead of ports.

map.description: The actual map of devices for the hardware mapping.

name.description: The name of this hardware mapping.

block.description: Manages a USB hardware mapping in a Proxmox VE cluster.

comment.description: The comment associated with this resource.

group.description: The identifier of the High Availability group this resource is a member of.

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

max_relocate.description: The maximal number of relocation attempts.

max_restart.description: The maximal number of restart attempts.

state.description: The desired state of the resource.

type.description: The type of HA resources to create. If unset, it will be deduced from the `resource_id`.

disable.description: Set this to `true` to disable this metric server.

graphite_proto.description: Protocol to send graphite data. Choice is between `udp` | `tcp`. If not set, PVE default is `udp`.

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

influx_api_path_prefix.description: An API path prefix inserted between `<host>:<port>/` and `/api2/`. Can be useful if the InfluxDB service runs behind a reverse proxy.

influx_bucket.description: The InfluxDB bucket/db. Only necessary when using the http v2 api.

influx_db_proto.description: Protocol for InfluxDB. Choice is between `udp` | `http` | `https`. If not set, PVE default is `udp`.

influx_max_body_size.description: InfluxDB max-body-size in bytes. Requests are batched up to this size. If not set, PVE default is `25000000`.

influx_organization.description: The InfluxDB organization. Only necessary when using the http v2 api. Has no meaning when using v2 compatibility api.

influx_token.description: The InfluxDB access token. Only necessary when using the http v2 api. If the v2 compatibility api is used, use `user:password` instead.

influx_verify.description: Set to `false` to disable certificate verification for https endpoints.

mtu.description: MTU (maximum transmission unit) for metrics transmission over UDP. If not set, PVE default is `1500` (allowed `512` - `65536`).

name.description: Unique name that will be ID of this metric server in PVE.

server.description: Server dns name or IP address.

timeout.description: TCP socket timeout in seconds. If not set, PVE default is `1`.

autostart.description: Automatically start interface on boot (defaults to `true`).

id.description: A unique identifier with format `<node name>:<iface>`

name.description: The interface name. Commonly vmbr[N], where 0 ≤ N ≤ 4094 (vmbr0 - vmbr4094), but can be any alphanumeric string that starts with a character and is at most 10 characters long.

vlan_aware.description: Whether the interface bridge is VLAN aware (defaults to `false`).

block.description: Manages a Linux Bridge network interface in a Proxmox VE node.

autostart.description: Automatically start interface on boot (defaults to `true`).

id.description: A unique identifier with format `<node name>:<iface>`.

interface.description: The VLAN raw device. See also `name`.

name.description: The interface name. Either add the VLAN tag number to an existing interface name, e.g. `ens18.21` (and do not set `interface` and `vlan`), or use custom name, e.g. `vlan_lab` (`interface` and `vlan` are then required).

block.description: Manages a Linux VLAN network interface in a Proxmox VE node.

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

exit_nodes.description: List of exit nodes for EVPN.

exit_nodes_local_routing.description: Enable local routing for EVPN exit nodes.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets should be deployed on

vrf_vxlan.description: VRF VXLAN-ID used for dedicated routing interconnect between VNets. It must be different than the VXLAN-ID of the VNets.

block.description: EVPN Zone in Proxmox SDN. The EVPN zone creates a routable Layer 3 network, capable of spanning across multiple clusters.

bridge.description: A local, VLAN-aware bridge that is already configured on each local node

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets should be deployed on

service_vlan.description: Service VLAN tag for QinQ. The tag must be between `1` and `4094`.

service_vlan_protocol.description: Service VLAN protocol for QinQ. The protocol must be `802.1ad` or `802.1q`.

block.description: QinQ Zone in Proxmox SDN. QinQ also known as VLAN stacking, that uses multiple layers of VLAN tags for isolation. The QinQ zone defines the outer VLAN tag (the Service VLAN) whereas the inner VLAN tag is defined by the VNet. Your physical network switches must support stacked VLANs for this configuration. Due to the double stacking of tags, you need 4 more bytes for QinQ VLANs. For example, you must reduce the MTU to 1496 if you physical interface MTU is 1500.

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets should be deployed on

block.description: Simple Zone in Proxmox SDN. It will create an isolated VNet bridge. This bridge is not linked to a physical interface, and VM traffic is only local on each the node. It can be used in NAT or routed setups.

bridge.description: The local bridge or OVS switch, already configured on _each_ node that allows node-to-node connection.

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets should be deployed on

block.description: VLAN Zone in Proxmox SDN. It uses an existing local Linux or OVS bridge to connect to the node's physical interface. It uses VLAN tagging defined in the VNet to isolate the network segments. This allows connectivity of VMs between different nodes.

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets should be deployed on

peers.description: A list of IP addresses of each node in the VXLAN zone. This can be external nodes reachable at this IP address. All nodes in the cluster need to be mentioned here

block.description: VXLAN Zone in Proxmox SDN. It establishes a tunnel (overlay) on top of an existing network (underlay). This encapsulates layer 2 Ethernet frames within layer 4 UDP datagrams using the default destination port 4789. You have to configure the underlay network yourself to enable UDP connectivity between all peers. Because VXLAN encapsulation uses 50 bytes, the MTU needs to be 50 bytes lower than the outgoing physical interface.

enabled.description: Whether the user account is enabled

propagate.description: Whether to propagate to child paths

id.description: Unique token identifier with format `<user_id>!<token_name>`.

privileges_separation.description: Restrict API token privileges with separate ACLs (default), or give full privileges of corresponding user.

value.description: API token value used for authentication. It is populated only when creating a new token, and can't be retrieved at import.

boot_order.description: The guest will attempt to boot from devices in the order they appear here

ipv4_addresses.description: The IPv4 addresses published by the QEMU agent

ipv6_addresses.description: The IPv6 addresses published by the QEMU agent

mac_addresses.description: The MAC addresses for the network interfaces

machine.description: The VM machine type, either default `pc` or `q35`

migrate.description: Whether to migrate the VM on node change instead of re-creating it

name.description: The name

network_interface_names.description: The network interface names published by the QEMU agent

pool_id.description: The ID of the pool to assign the virtual machine to

protection.description: Sets the protection flag of the VM. This will disable the remove VM and remove disk operations

reboot.description: Whether to reboot VM after creation

reboot_after_update.description: Whether to reboot VM after update if needed

started.description: Whether to start the virtual machine

stop_on_destroy.description: Whether to stop rather than shutdown on VM destroy

tablet_device.description: Whether to enable the USB tablet device

tags.description: Tags of the virtual machine. This is only meta information.

enabled.description: Whether to enable the QEMU agent

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for data from the QEMU agent to become available

trim.description: Whether to enable the FSTRIM feature in the QEMU agent

allow_smt.description: Sets policy bit to allow Simultaneous Multi Threading (SMT) (Ignored unless for SEV-SNP)

kernel_hashes.description: Add kernel hashes to guest firmware for measured linux kernel launch

no_debug.description: Sets policy bit to disallow debugging of guest

no_key_sharing.description: Sets policy bit to disallow key sharing with other guests (Ignored for SEV-SNP)

type.description: Enable standard SEV with type=std or enable experimental SEV-ES with the es optionor enable experimental SEV-SNP with the snp option.

block.description: Secure Encrypted Virtualization (SEV) features by AMD CPUs

enabled.description: Whether to enable the audio device
Whether to enable the CDROM drive

datastore_id.description: The ID of the target datastore

full.description: The Clone Type, create a Full Clone (true) or a linked Clone (false)

node_name.description: The name of the source node

retries.description: The number of Retries to create a clone

vm_id.description: The ID of the source VM

backup.description: Whether the drive should be included when making backups

discard.description: Whether to pass discard/trim requests to the underlying storage.

file_id.description: The file id for a disk image

import_from.description: The file id of a disk image to import from storage.

iothread.description: Whether to use iothreads for this disk drive

path_in_datastore.description: The in-datastore path to disk image

replicate.description: Whether the drive should be considered for replication jobs

ssd.description: Whether to use ssd for this disk drive

iops_read.description: The maximum read I/O in operations per second

iops_read_burstable.description: The maximum unthrottled read I/O pool in operations per second

iops_write.description: The maximum write I/O in operations per second

iops_write_burstable.description: The maximum unthrottled write I/O pool in operations per second

read.description: The maximum read speed in megabytes per second

read_burstable.description: The maximum burstable read speed in megabytes per second

write.description: The maximum write speed in megabytes per second

write_burstable.description: The maximum burstable write speed in megabytes per second

pre_enrolled_keys.description: Use an EFI vars template with distribution-specific and Microsoft Standard keys enrolled, if used with efi type=`4m`.

type.description: Size and type of the OVMF EFI disk

device.description: The PCI device name for Proxmox, in form of 'hostpciX' where X is a sequential number from 0 to 3

id.description: The PCI ID of the device, for example 0000:00:1f.0 (or 0000:00:1f.0;0000:00:1f.1 for multiple device functions, or 0000:00:1f for all functions). Use either this or mapping.

mapping.description: The resource mapping name of the device, for example gpu. Use either this or id.

mdev.description: The the mediated device to use

pcie.description: Tells Proxmox VE to use a PCIe or PCI port. Some guests/device combination require PCIe rather than PCI. PCIe is only available for q35 machine types.

rom_file.description: A path to a ROM file for the device to use. This is a relative path under /usr/share/kvm/

rombar.description: Makes the firmware ROM visible for the guest. Default is true

xvga.description: Marks the PCI(e) device as the primary GPU of the VM. With this enabled, the vga configuration argument will be ignored.

block.description: The Host PCI devices mapped to the VM

interface.description: The IDE interface on which the CloudInit drive will be added

meta_data_file_id.description: The ID of a file containing meta data config

network_data_file_id.description: The ID of a file containing network config

user_data_file_id.description: The ID of a file containing custom user data

vendor_data_file_id.description: The ID of a file containing vendor data

keep_hugepages.description: Hugepages will not be deleted after VM shutdown and can be used for subsequent starts

disconnected.description: Whether the network device should be disconnected from the network

enabled.description: Whether to enable the network device

firewall.description: Whether this interface's firewall rules should be used

queues.description: Number of packet queues to be used on the device

rate_limit.description: The rate limit in megabytes per second

trunks.description: List of VLAN trunks for the network interface

memory.description: Amount of memory this NUMA node provides

max_bytes.description: Maximum bytes of entropy allowed to get injected into the guest every `period` milliseconds. Prefer a lower value when using `/dev/random` as source.

period.description: Every `period` milliseconds the entropy-injection quota is reset, allowing the guest to retrieve another `max_bytes` of entropy.

source.description: The file on the host to gather entropy from. In most cases, `/dev/urandom` should be preferred over `/dev/random` to avoid entropy-starvation issues on the host.

block.description: Specifies SMBIOS (type1) settings for the VM

down_delay.description: A non-negative number defining the delay in seconds before the next VM is shut down

order.description: A non-negative number defining the general startup order

up_delay.description: A non-negative number defining the delay in seconds before the next VM is started

block.description: Defines startup and shutdown behavior of the VM

host.description: The USB device ID for Proxmox, in form of '<MANUFACTURER>:<ID>'

mapping.description: The resource mapping name of the device, for example usbdisk. Use either this or id.

usb3.description: Makes the USB device a USB3 device for the machine. Default is false

block.description: The Host USB devices mapped to the VM

clipboard.description: Enable clipboard support. Set to `vnc` to enable clipboard support for VNC.

memory.description: The VGA memory in megabytes (4-512 MB)

expose_acl.description: Enable POSIX ACLs, implies xattr support

file_id.description: The file ID of the CD-ROM, or `cdrom|none`. Defaults to `none` to leave the CD-ROM empty. Use `cdrom` to connect to the physical drive.

cdrom.description: The CD-ROM configuration. The key is the interface of the CD-ROM, could be one of `ideN`, `sataN`, `scsiN`, where N is the index of the interface. Note that `q35` machine type only supports `ide0` and `ide2` of IDE interfaces.

id.description: The ID of the VM to clone.

retries.description: The number of retries to perform when cloning the VM (default: 3).

affinity.description: The CPU cores that are used to run the VM’s vCPU. The value is a list of CPU IDs, separated by commas. The CPU IDs are zero-based.  For example, `0,1,2,3` (which also can be shortened to `0-3`) means that the VM’s vCPUs are run on the first four CPU cores. Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

architecture.description: The CPU architecture `<aarch64 | x86_64>` (defaults to the host). Setting `affinity` is only allowed for `root@pam` authenticated user.

cores.description: The number of CPU cores per socket (defaults to `1`).

flags.description: Set of additional CPU flags. Use `+FLAG` to enable, `-FLAG` to disable a flag. Custom CPU models can specify any flag supported by QEMU/KVM, VM-specific flags must be from the following set for security reasons: `pcid`, `spec-ctrl`, `ibpb`, `ssbd`, `virt-ssbd`, `amd-ssbd`, `amd-no-ssb`, `pdpe1gb`, `md-clear`, `hv-tlbflush`, `hv-evmcs`, `aes`.

hotplugged.description: The number of hotplugged vCPUs (defaults to `0`).

limit.description: Limit of CPU usage (defaults to `0` which means no limit).

sockets.description: The number of CPU sockets (defaults to `1`).

type.description: Emulated CPU type, it's recommended to use `x86-64-v2-AES` or higher (defaults to `kvm64`). See https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings for more information.

units.description: CPU weight for a VM. Argument is used in the kernel fair scheduler. The larger the number is, the more CPU time this VM gets. Number is relative to weights of all the other running VMs.

id.description: The unique identifier of the VM in the Proxmox cluster.

name.description: The name of the VM. Doesn't have to be unique.

node_name.description: The name of the node where the VM is provisioned.

max_bytes.description: Maximum bytes of entropy allowed to get injected into the guest every period. Use 0 to disable limiting (potentially dangerous).

period.description: Period in milliseconds to limit entropy injection to the guest. Use 0 to disable limiting (potentially dangerous).

source.description: The file on the host to gather entropy from. In most cases, `/dev/urandom` should be preferred over `/dev/random` to avoid entropy-starvation issues on the host.

rng.description: Configure the RNG (Random Number Generator) device. The RNG device provides entropy to guests to ensure good quality random numbers for guest applications that require them. Can only be set by `root@pam.`See the [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings) for more information.

stop_on_destroy.description: Set to true to stop (rather than shutdown) the VM on destroy (defaults to `false`).

tags.description: The tags assigned to the VM.

template.description: Set to true to create a VM template.

create.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

delete.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Setting a timeout for a Delete operation is only applicable if changes are saved into state before the destroy operation occurs.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

update.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours).

clipboard.description: Enable a specific clipboard. If not set, depending on the display type the SPICE one will be added. Currently only `vnc` is available. Migration with VNC clipboard is not supported by Proxmox.

memory.description: The VGA memory in megabytes (4-512 MB). Has no effect with serial display.

vga.description: Configure the VGA Hardware. If you want to use high resolution modes (>= 1280x1024x16) you may need to increase the vga memory option. Since QEMU 2.9 the default VGA display type is `std` for all OS types besides some Windows versions (XP and older) which use `cirrus`. The `qxl` option enables the SPICE display server. For win* OS you can select how many independent displays you want, Linux guests can add displays themself. You can also run without any graphic card, using a serial device as terminal. See the [Proxmox documentation](https://pve.proxmox.com/pve-docs/pve-admin-guide.html#qm_virtual_machines_settings) section 10.2.8 for more information and available configuration parameters.

block.description:
This is an experimental implementation of a Proxmox VM resource using Plugin Framework.

It is a Proof of Concept, highly experimental and **will** change in future. It does not support all features of the Proxmox API for VMs and **MUST NOT** be used in production.

contact.description: An array of contact email addresses.

created_at.description: The timestamp of the account creation.

status.description: The status of the account. Can be one of `valid`, `deactivated` or `revoked`.

directory.description: The directory URL of the ACME account.

location.description: The location URL of the ACME account.

name.description: The identifier of the ACME account to read.

tos.description: The URL of the terms of service of the ACME account.

block.description: Retrieves information about a specific ACME account.

accounts.description: The identifiers of the ACME accounts.

block.description: Retrieves the list of ACME accounts.

digest.description: Prevent changes if current configuration file has a different digest. This can be used to prevent concurrent modifications.

validation_delay.description: Extra delay in seconds to wait before requesting validation. Allows to cope with a long TTL of DNS records (0 - 172800).

block.description: Retrieves a single ACME plugin by plugin ID name.

digest.description: Prevent changes if current configuration file has a different digest. This can be used to prevent concurrent modifications.

validation_delay.description: Extra delay in seconds to wait before requesting validation. Allows to cope with a long TTL of DNS records (0 - 172800).

block.description: Retrieves the list of ACME plugins.

file_path.description: The absolute path of the source list file that contains this repository.

file_type.description: The format of the defining source list file.

id.description: The unique identifier of this APT repository data source.

index.description: The index within the defining source list file.

node.description: The name of the target Proxmox VE node.

block.description: Retrieves an APT repository from a Proxmox VE cluster.

description.description: The description of the APT standard repository.

file_path.description: The absolute path of the source list file that contains this standard repository.

handle.description: The handle of the APT standard repository.

id.description: The unique identifier of this APT standard repository data source.

index.description: The index within the defining source list file.

name.description: The name of the APT standard repository.

node.description: The name of the target Proxmox VE node.

block.description: Retrieves an APT standard repository from a Proxmox VE cluster.

name.description: The Container name

template.description: Is Container a template (true) or a regular Container (false)

id.description: The ID of the store.

node_name.description: The name of the node the store is on.

content_types.description: Only list stores with the given content types.

id.description: Only list stores with the given ID.

target.description: If `target` is different to `node_name`, then only lists shared stores which content is accessible on this node and the specified `target` node.

filters.description: The filters to apply to the stores.

node_name.description: The name of the node to retrieve the stores from.

block.description: Retrieves information about all the datastores available to a specific node.

comment.description: The comment associated with this group

group.description: The identifier of the High Availability group to read.

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

no_failback.description: A flag that indicates that failing back to a higher priority node is disabled for this HA group.

nodes.description: The member nodes for this group. They are provided as a map, where the keys are the node names and the values represent their priority: integers for known priorities or `null` for unset priorities.

restricted.description: A flag that indicates that other nodes may not be used to run resources associated to this HA group.

block.description: Retrieves information about a specific High Availability group.

group_ids.description: The identifiers of the High Availability groups.

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

block.description: Retrieves the list of High Availability groups.

comment.description: The comment of this directory mapping.

id.description: The unique identifier of this directory mapping data source.

node.description: The node name attribute of the map.

path.description: The path attribute of the map.

map.description: The actual map of devices for the directory mapping.

name.description: The name of this directory mapping.

comment.description: The comment of this PCI hardware mapping.

id.description: The unique identifier of this PCI hardware mapping data source.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped PCI device.

id.description: The ID attribute of the map.

iommu_group.description: The IOMMU group attribute of the map.

node.description: The node name attribute of the map.

path.description: The path attribute of the map.

subsystem_id.description: The subsystem ID attribute of the map.Not mandatory for the Proxmox VE API call, but causes a PCI hardware mapping to be incomplete when not set.

map.description: The actual map of devices for the hardware mapping.

mediated_devices.description: Indicates whether to use with mediated devices.

name.description: The name of this PCI hardware mapping.

block.description: Retrieves a PCI hardware mapping from a Proxmox VE cluster.

comment.description: The comment of this USB hardware mapping.

id.description: The unique identifier of this USB hardware mapping data source.

comment.description: The comment of the mapped USB device.

id.description: The ID attribute of the map.

node.description: The node name attribute of the map.

path.description: The path attribute of the map.

map.description: The actual map of devices for the hardware mapping.

name.description: The name of this USB hardware mapping.

block.description: Retrieves a USB hardware mapping from a Proxmox VE cluster.

check_node.description: The name of the node whose configurations should be checked for correctness.

mapping_id.description: The corresponding hardware mapping ID of the node check diagnostic entry.

message.description: The message of the node check diagnostic entry.

severity.description: The severity of the node check diagnostic entry.

checks.description: Might contain relevant diagnostics about incorrect configurations.

id.description: The unique identifier of this hardware mappings data source.

ids.description: The identifiers of the hardware mappings.

type.description: The type of the hardware mappings.

block.description: Retrieves a list of hardware mapping resources.

comment.description: The comment associated with this resource.

group.description: The identifier of the High Availability group this resource is a member of.

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

max_relocate.description: The maximal number of relocation attempts.

max_restart.description: The maximal number of restart attempts.

resource_id.description: The identifier of the Proxmox HA resource to read.

state.description: The desired state of the resource.

type.description: The type of High Availability resource (`vm` or `ct`).

block.description: Retrieves the list of High Availability resources.

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

resource_ids.description: The identifiers of the High Availability resources.

type.description: The type of High Availability resources to fetch (`vm` or `ct`). All resources will be fetched if this option is unset.

block.description: Retrieves the list of High Availability resources.

disable.description: Indicates if the metric server is disabled.

id.description: The unique identifier of this resource.

name.description: Unique name that will be ID of this metric server in PVE.

server.description: Server dns name or IP address.

block.description: Retrieves information about a specific PVE metric server.

cpu_count.description: The CPU count on the node

cpu_model.description: The CPU model on the node

cpu_sockets.description: The CPU sockets on the node

memory_available.description: The available memory in bytes on the node

memory_total.description: The total memory in bytes on the node

memory_used.description: The used memory in bytes on the node

uptime.description: The uptime in seconds on the node

cpu_count.description: The CPU count for each node

cpu_utilization.description: The CPU utilization on each node

memory_available.description: The available memory in bytes on each node

memory_used.description: The used memory in bytes on each node

ssl_fingerprints.description: The SSL fingerprint for each node

support_levels.description: The support level for each node

uptime.description: The uptime in seconds for each node

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

exit_nodes.description: List of exit nodes for EVPN.

exit_nodes_local_routing.description: Enable local routing for EVPN exit nodes.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets are deployed on

rt_import.description: Route target import for EVPN. Must be in the format '<ASN>:<number>' (e.g., '65000:65000').

vrf_vxlan.description: VRF VXLAN-ID used for dedicated routing interconnect between VNets. It must be different than the VXLAN-ID of the VNets.

block.description: Retrieves information about an EVPN Zone in Proxmox SDN. The EVPN zone creates a routable Layer 3 network, capable of spanning across multiple clusters.

bridge.description: A local, VLAN-aware bridge that is already configured on each local node

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets are deployed on

service_vlan.description: Service VLAN tag for QinQ. The tag must be between `1` and `4094`.

service_vlan_protocol.description: Service VLAN protocol for QinQ. The protocol must be `802.1ad` or `802.1q`.

block.description: Retrieves information about a QinQ Zone in Proxmox SDN. QinQ also known as VLAN stacking, that uses multiple layers of VLAN tags for isolation. The QinQ zone defines the outer VLAN tag (the Service VLAN) whereas the inner VLAN tag is defined by the VNet. Your physical network switches must support stacked VLANs for this configuration. Due to the double stacking of tags, you need 4 more bytes for QinQ VLANs. For example, you must reduce the MTU to 1496 if you physical interface MTU is 1500.

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets are deployed on

block.description: Retrieves information about a Simple Zone in Proxmox SDN. It will create an isolated VNet bridge. This bridge is not linked to a physical interface, and VM traffic is only local on each the node. It can be used in NAT or routed setups.

bridge.description: The local bridge or OVS switch, already configured on _each_ node that allows node-to-node connection.

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets are deployed on

block.description: Retrieves information about a VLAN Zone in Proxmox SDN. It uses an existing local Linux or OVS bridge to connect to the node's physical interface. It uses VLAN tagging defined in the VNet to isolate the network segments. This allows connectivity of VMs between different nodes.

dns_zone.description: DNS domain name. Used to register hostnames, such as `<hostname>.<domain>`. The DNS zone must already exist on the DNS server.

id.description: The unique identifier of the SDN zone.

nodes.description: The Proxmox nodes which the zone and associated VNets are deployed on

peers.description: A list of IP addresses of each node in the VXLAN zone. This can be external nodes reachable at this IP address. All nodes in the cluster need to be mentioned here

block.description: Retrieves information about a VXLAN Zone in Proxmox SDN. It establishes a tunnel (overlay) on top of an existing network (underlay). This encapsulates layer 2 Ethernet frames within layer 4 UDP datagrams using the default destination port 4789. You have to configure the underlay network yourself to enable UDP connectivity between all peers. Because VXLAN encapsulation uses 50 bytes, the MTU needs to be 50 bytes lower than the outgoing physical interface.

type.description: Filter zones by type (simple, vlan, qinq, vxlan, evpn).

block.description: Retrieves information about all SDN Zones in Proxmox. This data source can optionally filter zones by type.

enabled.description: Whether the user account is enabled
Whether a user account is enabled

id.description: Placeholder identifier attribute.

release.description: The current Proxmox VE point release in `x.y` format.

repository_id.description: The short git revision from which this version was build.

version.description: The full pve-manager package version of this node.

name.description: The VM name

template.description: Is VM a template (true) or a regular VM (false)

id.description: The ID of the VM to clone.

retries.description: The number of retries to perform when cloning the VM (default: 3).

affinity.description: List of host cores used to execute guest processes, for example: '0,5,8-11'

cores.description: The number of CPU cores per socket.

id.description: The unique identifier of the VM in the Proxmox cluster.

name.description: The name of the VM.

node_name.description: The name of the node where the VM is provisioned.

max_bytes.description: Maximum bytes of entropy allowed to get injected into the guest every period.

period.description: Period in milliseconds to limit entropy injection to the guest.

source.description: The entropy source for the RNG device.

tags.description: The tags assigned to the VM.

template.description: Whether the VM is a template.

read.description: A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration) consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (minutes), "h" (hours). Read operations occur during any refresh or planning operation when refresh is enabled.

memory.description: The VGA memory in megabytes (4-512 MB). Has no effect with serial display.

block.description: This is an experimental implementation of a Proxmox VM datasource using Plugin Framework.

node_name.description: The node name. All cluster nodes will be queried in case this is omitted

tags.description: Tags of the VM to match

name.description: Attribute to filter on. One of [name, template, status, node_name]

values.description: List of values to pass the filter (OR logic)
